setting.conf_title_desc: Settings for the GeSHi code highlighter

setting.conf_description: Auto-Caps/NoCaps is a nifty little feature that capitalises or lowercases automatically certain lexics when they are styled. QuickBASIC, a dialect of BASIC which is well known for it’s capatalisation, and SQL is another language well known for using caps for readability.
setting.conf_extra: 0=Don’t change the case of any lexics, leave as they are found 1=Uppercase all lexics found 2=Lowercase all lexics found

setting.conf_description: GeSHi provides the option to link function names (such as in PHP, fopen( .. ) would link to http://php.net/fopen. These links are safe to use and can be considered helpful for users.
If the user does not specify the language, what should we default to?

setting.conf_title: Use CSS file instead of inline
setting.conf_description: By default GeSHi loads all styles inline with the code instead of in a stylesheet. By switching to a stylesheet, you allow the user to cache the file. However it should be noted that this file can be large if you are using a lot of languages.
If you wish to enable fancy line numbers, enter in the n<sup style="font-size:60%;">th</sup> line you want to be bold. To disable fancy line numbers. leave blank or set to 0.

setting.conf_title: Hide line numbers if no starting number
setting.conf_description: Should we hide the line numbers if the user gave us no starting line number, or gave 0?

Users have the ability to highlight lines (Demo) based on characters they put at the beginning of that line.

For example, if "##" is the value and the following code is put in the editor:
<?php
##$foo = true;
foobar('test');

"$foo = true;" would be highlighted.

If you wish to disable this setting set to an empty string.
Should the old bbcodes (html, php, sql, xml) be parsed too? <!--NOTICE-->
The size of the tab, in spaces.
